Simone Gbagbo, Côte d'Ivoire's former first lady running for president
subhead: Unlike her ex-husband Laurent Gbagbo, who served as president from 2000 to 2010 and is barred from running, Simone Gbagbo is set to face his former archrival at the polls: President Alassane Ouattara, the clear favorite in the race.

French prosecutors demand maximum sentence for woman who murdered 12-year-old girl
subhead: Dahbia Benkired, 27, is accused of the murder, rape and torture of a girl identified as Lola. The case sparked intense controversy in France, as the young Algerian woman was under a deportation order.

title: Trump announces all trade talks with Canada 'terminated' due to 'egregious behavior'
subhead: The latest extraordinary twist in relations between the North American neighbors comes just over two weeks after Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney visited Trump in the White House to seek a relaxation of stiff US tariffs.

title: Michel Devoret, 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics laureate, has fun in the quantum tunnel
subhead: Honored by the Swedish Academy alongside his colleagues John Clarke and John Martinis for research conducted 40 years ago, the French scientist now wants to engage with young people to popularize his field.

title: Twelve artistic happenings to catch outside Art Basel Paris
subhead: Alongside the fourth edition of the event, a host of events are taking place in various venues across the French capital. From exhibitions and monumental installations to off-site fairs, here is a selection from Le Monde's culture journalists.

Three years after taking power in Italy, Meloni is dropping the mask
subhead: Appointed in October 2022, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has reassured Brussels and financial markets, notably by reducing the public deficit. But behind this conciliatory image lies a far-right leader who has drawn ever closer to Donald Trump, even going so far as to imitate him on the domestic stage.

title: Fighting their own country: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainians are forcibly conscripted by Russia
subhead: Moscow is pursuing a policy of forced Russification and militarization in occupied territories, aiming to turn the local population into soldiers. These Ukrainians account for one quarter of the prisoners of war held by Kyiv, Le Monde reveals.

title: 'Russian Secrets': How Russia built an Arctic spy network using European equipment
subhead: Hidden behind shell companies, Russia acquired advanced Western technologies to build a secret underwater network designed to protect its nuclear weapons. The incident raises questions about Europe's ability to prevent the export of sensitive technologies to Moscow.
